import React, { useState, useContext, useEffect } from 'react' import "./styles.css" import menuContext from '../context/menuContext'; const Menu = () => { const context = useContext(menuContext); const { addMenu } = context; const [menu, setMenu] = useState({ name: "", category: "", menus: "", description: "" }); const [selectedCategory, setSelectedCategory] = useState(""); const [menuData, setMenuData] = useState([]); // State to store fetched data const categories = ["Chinese", "Italian", "Indian", "Beverages"]; useEffect(() => { // Fetch data when the component mounts fetch('/api/menuData/fetchmenudata') .then(response => response.json()) .then(data => setMenuData(data)) .catch(error => console.error('Error fetching data:', error)); }, []); // The empty array [] ensures this effect runs once when the component mounts const handleCategorySelect = (category) => { setSelectedCategory(category); setMenu({ ...menu, category }); } const handleClick = (e) => { e.preventDefault(); addMenu(menu.name, menu.category, menu.menus, menu.description); setMenu({ name: "", category: "", menus: "", description: "" }) } const onChange = (e) => { setMenu({ ...menu, [e.target.name]: e.target.value }) } return (

Add New Category

    {categories.map((category, index) => (
    • ))}
{/* */}

{menuItem.category}
))}

) } export default Menu
